Articles.Content:
I'm unfamiliar with how to programmatically access UI elements, and I'm not finding much in the docs. Is there a way to detect whether the navball is currently open?

Edit: Same question, but for overlay elements, like the temperature gauges, temperature overlay, aerodynamic forces overlay, etc. Just point me in the right direction to start looking, I'll probably figure out it.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-09T00:43:08Z" title="05/09/2015 12:43  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 9, 2015</time> by uberk**

For the navball

    FlightUIModeController.Instance.navBall.expanded

The other stuff is in PhysicsGlobals

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-09T01:23:58Z" title="05/09/2015 01:23  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 9, 2015</time> by Crzyrndm**

PhysicsGlobals got me everything except the temperature gauges, the ones you turn on and off with F10. Is that somewhere else? Or am I blind? (I figured it was PhysicsGlobals.ThermalDataDisplay, but that doesn't seem to be it.)
